name: Doom & Destiny
description: Be ready for the nerdiest adventure of your life! Journey with four everyday friends into this turn based hilarious jrpg filled with parodies and cameos! Explore a huge fantasy world full of secrets, monsters, dungeons and preposterous villains! Nerds are storming fantasy and it's awesome!

Really well made game, it's a solid jrpg filled with humour.  You get to play with 4 characters that have fixed classes, but with the power system you can go for different builds. So the Warrior can decide to go 'Paladin' by taking magical damage attacks (Smite Evil, Fire Sword,...), the Ninja can decide to go 'Monk' by taking fist attacks (Stunning Fist, Fist of the South Star,...) and so on. This allows for a bit of replayability if someone wants to try different builds.  The story (which is very good IMHO) isn't really hard to finish, but after the end you get the choice to keep playing for some late game challenges. This last part is a bit grindy (you need a lot of gold to buy the ultimate equipment and powers) but it's still still enjoyable. And you get to fight the Flying Spaghetti Monster.  The authors of this game are italians, so italian players might get one joke or two more than the others (loved the Rat-Man reference :D )  Buy it.
great old school feel

Have you been starved for a rewarding RPg experience? This is it. Exploration is always a reward, to the point that you can 'grind' for better point *while searching for better things*. It's sad that such an idea needs to be revolutionary, but you'll always be interested in any task you're doing. The world will let you know when you've gone too far, but there are stackable rewards for your grinding when you decide to stay.  If hiliarious story, interactive combat, and depth of gameplay options appeal to you, then I honestly can't think of a better RPG on the market.  If you're not looking for those things, then, umm... what are you doing here?

This game is a hoot. Many people have tried to capture the fun of old school JRPG's and lots of people have tried to infuse such efforts with tongue-in-cheek humor, but Doom and Destiny actually does both. If you enjoy old school Final Fantasy or Dragon Warrior games, then you owe it to yourself to try this one.

I took a chance on it because it was on sale. I'm super glad I did, because It's just as much fun as the old school classics it resembles.   Great story, funny dialogue, huge world to explore at your leisure, tons of tricky secrets and side quests, customizable builds -- it's got everything. And it's at least part parody, so there are a lot of funny cameos, tropes, and music that sounds vaguely familiar... Haha. I love the self-referential humour and breaking of the fourth wall.  I was sad when I beat the 'final' boss because I didn't want the game to end, BUT IT DIDN'T! There are all kinds of brand new areas that become accessible in endgame. It's the gift that just keeps on giving.
